characters.definition: A warrior assisting the druid Cian on the journey to Caer Aras.
The former Champion of King Rónán.
A druid assigned to King Fiachra's lands. Assists Deaglán after he comes through the Gate.
A student at Loch Traenala.
The name given to Vis by Gráinne and her family, and which he adopts.
Senior druid to King Rónán.

characters.title: King
characters.definition: Rival to King Rónán. Has struck a deal with the Grove to give them unfettered access to Solivagus.
A student at Loch Traenala.
King Rónán's Champion.
The woman who takes in Deaglán. Mother to Róisín and Tadgh. Daughter to Onchú.
A warrior assisting the druid Cian on the journey to Caer Aras.
The derogatory nickname given to Deaglán by Gallchobhar.
The druid who takes Vis to Caer Aras.
A student at Loch Traenala.
The captain of the ship to Loch Traenala.

characters.title: King
characters.definition: The king of a region neighbouring King Rónán's lands.
Father of Gráinne, grandfather to Róisín and Tadgh.
The instructor at Loch Traenala.
A younger student at Loch Traenala.
Daughter of Gráinne.

characters.title: King
characters.definition: King of the lands to which Deaglán flees. Father to Tara.
A druid who some believe is exerting undue influence over the Grove, and appears to want Vis dead.
A student at Loch Traenala.
Son of Gráinne.
Daughter of King Rónán. A student at Loch Traenala.
A druid from King Nuadha's lands.

characters.title: High King
characters.definition: The dying High King who rules over Rónán, Fiachra, Nuadha, and others.

glossary.definition: The High Council of the druids.
The word used for a warrior able to use Will.

locations.definition: A village and its surrounding region, in which Onchu's farm is located.
The testing grounds for both draoi and nasceann.
A mysterious white temple in the mountains.
The location of the training school for King Rónán's elite warriors.
